title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purpleâ€¦
But it is possible you first said green (donâ€™t worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


Itâ€™s a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | â€” | â€” | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It getâ€™s it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. ðŸŸª

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, Iâ€™ll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!

title: About
text: A little place filled with Michaelâ€™s musings

title: Generating a Profile Picture
text:
While looking through the Blog content, I was drawn to the idea of generating my own profile pictur using Dall-E 3. I immediately looked into generating my profile picture through some Python scripts in a notebook, but unfortunately, a lot of the documentation I was reviewing for image generation ended up being outdated (curse you openai updates>=1.0.0). I thought itâ€™d be way cooler to run a blog with code that I personally wrote, but Iâ€™ll be using Dall-E 3 in OpenAIâ€™s native web app with the 4o model.


To begin, I wanted to explore how Dall-E 3 percieved me based on a few personal details, and build from there.
So, who am I?:
Iâ€™m an Asian college man in my 21s studying computer science and communications. I have an orange cat and enjoy swimming. I want my profile picture to reflect these parts of my identity.
Thus, I had GPT 4o prompt engineer the text below for an optimized image of who I described myself to be above:
A portrait of an Asian college man in his 21s who is a CS and communications major, with an orange cat by his side and a hint of water in the background symbolizing his love for swimming. Realistic digital art, warm lighting.
Output: 
This image is a good starting point, but it feels a bit generic. Iâ€™d like to inject more personality and a stylized look.
I now wanted to refine the prompt to specify a more modern, digital illustration style that brings out my personality leading to prompt 2:
A modern digital illustration of an Asian college man in his 21s, majoring in computer science and communications, accompanied by his vibrant orange cat. The background subtly hints at swimming with abstract water elements. Minimalist design, bold lines, and a clean vector style.
Output: 
I appreciate the crisp vector look, and the text is a nice touch. It even made the ears pierced haha. Now, letâ€™s try something with richer details, like a painting style. Thus, we are lead to prompt 3:
A digital painting of an Asian college man in his 21s who studies computer science and communications, with his friendly orange cat by his side. The scene is set with a serene background featuring a swimming pool and gentle water reflections, evoking a sense of calm and creativity. Rich, warm color palette and artistic brushstrokes.
Output: 
Reflecting on this, I tried to avoid changing any details pertaining to the generated â€˜asian maleâ€™. Note that in each generation, the facial features are relatively similar, with the same exact haircut (same hair part too lol).

title: Generating a Profile Picture
text:
Deciding Upon a Profile Picture
Honestly, none of the images spoke to me very much due to their lack of ability to identify how I personally looked. Itâ€™s okay though! Iâ€™ve decided on something a little different (and better):
